Jx.Menu.Item

Extends: Jx.Button

A menu item is a single entry in a menu.  It is typically composed of a label and an optional icon.  Selecting the menu item emits an event.

Jx.Menu.Item is represented by a Jx.Button with type MenuItem and the associated CSS changes noted in Jx.Button.  The container of a MenuItem is an ‘li’ element.

Example

Events
clickfired when the menu item is clicked.

Summary
Jx.Menu.ItemExtends: Jx.Button
Options
templatethe HTML structure of the button. 
Functions
renderCreate a new instance of Jx.Menu.Item
changeTextupdates the label of the menu item on langChange Event for Internationalization



Options



template
the HTML structure of the button.   As a minimum, there must be a containing element with a class of jxMenuItemContainer and an internal element with a class of jxMenuItem.   jxMenuItemIcon and jxMenuItemLabel are used if present to put the image and label into the button.



Functions



render
render: function()
Create a new instance of Jx.Menu.Item



changeText
changeText: function(lang)
updates the label of the menu item on langChange Event for Internationalization
